intro: Globba brachyanthera var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved globba, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
